instructions: Sit on the floor with your feet together and your legs extended
Bend your right knee and bring the sole of your right foot close to your left thigh
Exhale as you bend at the hips, slowly lower your torso and grab your left foot
Hold the pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute and then switch sides
yoga poses.form: Keep your spine long, lower and lengthen your torso until your chest and belly touch the thigh, and feel the stretch in the back of the extended leg. Deepen the stretch as you exhale and, as you inhale, lengthen through the spine.
yoga poses.benefits: The head to knee forward bend pose stretches the hamstrings, lengthens the spine, strengthens the back muscles, and massages the abdominal organs. This pose calms the central nervous system, reduces stress, and relieves anxiety and mild depression.
related: wide legged forward bend twist pose
yoga poses.routine: Start with standing forward bend, bound angle or downward facing dog pose and then progress to head to knee forward bend pose. Follow-up with seated forward bend or reclining bound angle pose.
yoga poses.name: head to knee forward bend pose

instructions: Lie on your back with your legs extended and place your hands under the buttocks
Press your elbows and forearms into the floor, lift your chest and neck toward the ceiling and rest the crown of the head on the floor
Stay in fish pose for 15 to 30 seconds
yoga poses.form: Don’t put any pressure on your head and neck. Breathe slowly and use the arms, glutes, legs, and torso to support the posture.
yoga poses.benefits: The fish pose stretches the chest, abs, hip flexors, and the muscles in the front of the neck, and strengthens the back and the neck. This pose also stimulates the abdominal and thoracic organs and improves posture.
yoga poses.routine: Start with bow pose, locust pose or bridge pose and then progress to fish pose. Follow-up with cow face pose, camel pose or hero pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: Back or neck injury and migraine.
yoga poses.name: fish pose

instructions: Start in half moon pose, with your right hand on the floor and your left leg up
Rotate your right foot, knee, and hip to the front, lift the left foot toward the ceiling and gaze at your left thumb
Stay in extended half moon pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute and then repeat on the opposite side
yoga poses.form: Breathe smoothly throughout the pose, maintain the hips high and keep both arms and legs straight. Plant your right hand and foot firmly on the floor and actively reach up with your left leg and arm.
yoga poses.benefits: The extended half moon pose strengthens the wrists, arms, shoulders, core, and legs and improves balance and stability. This yoga pose also tones and stimulates the abdominal organs and prevents lower back pain.
related: extended hand to big toe pose
wide angle seated forward bend pose
yoga poses.routine: Start in half moon pose, mountain pose or side plank pose and then progress to extended half moon pose. Follow-up with wide legged forward bend or standing forward bend.
yoga poses.contraindications: Wrist, elbow, neck, shoulder, or back injury.
yoga poses.name: extended half moon pose

instructions: Start in plank pose and, as you exhale, lower your knees to the mat
Bring your chin and chest down to the floor and lift your tailbone up toward the ceiling
Stay in Ashtanga Namaskara for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Keep the elbows pointed back and close to your torso, and maintain your toes tucked in. Breathe smoothly, lower the chest and place it between your hands and keep the hips lifted and off the floor.
yoga poses.benefits: The knees chest chin pose improves the mobility and flexibility of the spine and neck, increases arm strength, and acts as a warm up pose for other backbends.
yoga poses.routine: Start with plank pose and follow-up with cobra or upward facing dog pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: Pregnancy, carpal tunnel syndrome, neck, shoulder, elbow, or wrist injury.
yoga poses.name: ashtanga namaskara

instructions: Lie down on your back, cover your body with a blanket and extend your arms and legs, letting them drop open
Close your eyes, allow your feet to rotate to the sides, and keep your palms facing up
Stay in Savasana for 5 to 15 minutes
yoga poses.form: Look for any tension or tightness in your body and consciously release all pressure and allow your body to melt into the floor. Focus on your breathing as you surrender your body to gravity.
yoga poses.benefits: Savasana is considered the most important pose in yoga. This pose allows your body and mind to fully relax and receive all the benefits from the previous poses and breathing exercises. It relieves stress, anxiety and depression, increases productivity and energy levels, and reduces insomnia, headaches and fatigue.
yoga poses.routine: Savasana is usually the last pose at the end of your yoga practice but it can also be used at the beginning, to calm the body, and in the middle, to rest and refocus.
yoga poses.name: savasana

instructions: Start in mountain pose, transfer your weight to the left foot, bend your right knee and clasp your right ankle
Place the sole of your right foot against the inner left thigh
Lengthen your torso, raise your arms above your head and press your hands together
Hold the pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute, reverse the legs, and repeat
yoga poses.form: Breathe deeply and slowly, engage your core to maintain balance, and keep your pelvis parallel to the floor. Gaze forward, point your hip bones to the front, and open your right knee out to the side.
yoga poses.benefits: The tree pose stretches the shoulders, chest, inner thighs and groins, and strengthens the legs and spine. This pose also improves your balance, concentration, and focus.
yoga poses.routine: Start in extended triangle or warrior II pose and then progress to tree pose. Follow-up with eagle pose or any other standing pose.
yoga poses.name: tree pose

instructions: Start in staff pose and open your legs as wide as it feels comfortable
Place your hands on the floor, walk your hands forward as far as you can and lengthen the torso
Stay in wide angle seated forward bend pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Keep your knees pointing up, press your thighs against the floor and exhale as you lean forward and lengthen the spine. Keep your arms long, draw your shoulders away from the ears and stretch the soles of the feet.
yoga poses.benefits: The wide angle seated forward bend pose stretches the legs and spine and opens the groin area. This yoga pose helps to relieve stress and tension and stimulates the abdominal organs.
related: extended hand to big toe pose
yoga poses.routine: Start in reclining bound angle, staff pose or wide legged forward bend and then progress to wide angle seated forward bend. Follow-up with garland pose or lotus pose.
yoga poses.name: wide angle seated forward bend pose

instructions: Lie on your belly, place your hands on the floor directly under the shoulders, and keep your elbows close to your torso
Inhale as you straighten the arms and lift your chest off the floor
Stay in cobra pose for 15 to 30 seconds
yoga poses.form: Root your pelvis, thighs, and tops of the feet to the floor. Be mindful as you extend your arms and distribute the stretch evenly along the spine. Do not fully extend your arms if this feels uncomfortable. Feel your hips narrowing and keep your shoulders and lower back relaxed.
yoga poses.benefits: The cobra pose opens the heart, has a calming and soothing effect on the mind, and stimulates the abdominal organs. This yoga pose stretches the chest, shoulders and abs, improves circulation, and increases the flexibility and strength of the spine.
yoga poses.routine: Start with bridge pose or sphinx pose and then progress to cobra pose. Follow-up with backbends.
yoga poses.contraindications: Pregnancy, fractured ribs or wrists, hernias, or back injury.
yoga poses.name: cobra pose

instructions: Start on your hands and knees with your shoulders directly over your hands and your hips directly over your knees
Press one leg straight back at a time and ground your toes
Stay in Phalakasana for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Keep your arms perpendicular to the floor with the shoulders directly over your hands, and ground your hands and toes on the floor. Maintain your core engaged, abs tight, look down, and keep your body in a straight line, from your head down to your feet.
yoga poses.benefits: The plank pose helps to build abdominal strength, improves posture, and keeps your spine aligned and healthy. It also strengthens your arms, shoulders and wrists, and prevents back pain.
yoga poses.routine: Start with downward facing dog pose and then progress to plank pose. Follow-up with Chaturanga Dandasana or Adho Mukha Svanasana.
yoga poses.contraindications: Carpal tunnel syndrome, back or shoulder injury.
yoga poses.name: plank pose

instructions: Start in mountain pose, transfer your weight to the left leg and as you inhale, lift your arms over your head
Exhale, raise your right leg back and bend at the hips until your upper body is parallel to the floor and in line with your right leg
Hold the pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute, return to mountain pose, and then repeat on the opposite side
yoga poses.form: Press the left heel into the floor and keep your arms, torso, and raised leg parallel to the floor. Actively reach your arms to the front and extend your raised leg back. Look down and stare at a fixed point for balance.
yoga poses.benefits: The Virabdhadrasana III tones and invigorates the whole body and strengthens the ankles, legs, shoulders, and back. This pose also improves balance and posture and boosts memory and concentration.
yoga poses.routine: Start in standing forward bend, warrior II or tree pose and then progress to warrior III pose. Follow-up with chair pose or any other standing pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: Leg, hip, back, or shoulder injury and high blood pressure.
yoga poses.name: warrior iii pose

instructions: Start in mountain pose, step back with your left foot and rotate your back toes, so that they point to the left front corner of the mat
Bend your right knee, keeping it in line with the ankle, and point the toes straight ahead
Bring the arms up and overhead with the palms facing inward
Hold the pose for 30 seconds and then return to mountain pose
Repeat on the opposite side
yoga poses.form: Ground your feet, keep your shoulders, chest and pelvis facing forward, and don’t allow the front knee to pass the ankle. Raise your arms, open the shoulders and look up toward the thumbs, being careful not to drop your head back. Draw the shoulder blades together and down the back, and create length by drawing the sacrum down.
yoga poses.benefits: The warrior I opens the chest and shoulders and strengthens the legs and back muscles. This pose helps to improve your flexibility, balance, and tones the abdominal muscles.
yoga poses.routine: Start in mountain pose, warrior II or downward facing dog and then progress to warrior I pose. Follow-up with warrior III pose on any backbends.
yoga poses.contraindications: Ankle, knee, hip, shoulder or neck injury, high blood pressure, and heart problems.
yoga poses.name: warrior i pose

instructions: Start in warrior II pose, bend your torso to the left and place your left hand on the inside of your left foot
Extend your right arm over the top of your head, pointing your fingertips in the same direction as the front toes, and gaze up toward the ceiling
Hold the pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute and then repeat on the opposite side
yoga poses.form: Keep your left shin perpendicular to the floor and keep your left shoulder directly over the right. Lengthen the spine and maintain your back heel, spine, and head in one straight line.
yoga poses.benefits: The extended side angle pose strengthens the legs, knees, and ankles, and stretches the chest, shoulders, spine, and groins. This pose also stimulates the abdominal organs, eases cramps, and increases stamina.
related: head to knee forward bend pose
wide legged forward bend twist pose
yoga poses.routine: Start with wide legged forward bend, extended triangle or warrior II pose and then progress to extended side angle pose. Follow-up with eagle pose, tree pose or bound angle pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: Knee, neck, hips, or back injury.
yoga poses.name: extended side angle pose

instructions: Start on your hands and knees, walk your right hand forward and slide the left hand between the right knee and the right hand
Twist your torso to the left and rest your head on the mat
Stay in thread the needle pose for 30 seconds, return to neutral position, reverse hands and repeat
yoga poses.form: Keep your neck neutral, release all the tension from your shoulders and keep your focus on your breathing, taking deep breaths throughout the entire exercise.
yoga poses.benefits: The thread the needle pose stretches the upper back and shoulders, calms the mind, and detoxifies the body.
related: cow face pose with eagle arms
easy pose with ear to shoulder stretch
yoga poses.routine: Start with child’s pose, cat pose or extended puppy pose and then progress to thread the needle pose. Follow-up with downward facing dog or hero pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: Knee, shoulder, back, or neck injury.
yoga poses.name: thread the needle pose

instructions: Lie on your back, bend both knees and place your feet flat on the floor
Slide the arms alongside the body and clasp the hands below your pelvis
Press the feet, shoulders, and arms into the floor, inhale and lift the hips and the chest up
Stay in bridge pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Breathe out as you lift your hips and chest up, feel the stretch in your chest, neck, spine, and hips, notice the blood flowing and breathe slowly. Exhale as you roll the spine back onto the floor.
yoga poses.benefits: The bridge pose has a calming effect on the central nervous system and helps reduce stress, anxiety, and insomnia. This pose stretches your chest, neck, spine, and hips, massages your abdominal organs, and stimulates your endocrine system.
yoga poses.routine: Start with cobra or reclining bound angle pose and then progress to bridge pose. Follow-up with shoulderstand or upward facing dog pose.
yoga poses.name: bridge pose

instructions: Start on your hands and knees and bring your left knee forward and out to the left side
Slide your right leg back and tuck your right toes under
Spread your left toes, elongate the spine, and gaze up
Stay in pigeon pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute, and then repeat with the opposite leg
yoga poses.form: Start with your knees under your hips and your hands slightly in front of your shoulders. Bring your left knee forward and out to the left, position your left foot in front of your right knee and rest the outside of your left foot on the floor. Slide your right leg back, straighten the knee, tuck your toes under and push through the fingertips to lift your torso up and lengthen the spine. Keep your hips squared, press your tailbone down and forward, open the chest, and gaze up.
yoga poses.benefits: The pigeon pose is a hip opener that stretches the thighs, groins, and psoas. This pose also stimulates the abdominal organs, opens the shoulders and chest, and stretches the neck.
yoga poses.routine: Start with bridge pose, reclining bound angle or cobra pose and then progress to pigeon pose. Follow-up with downward facing dog.
yoga poses.name: pigeon pose

instructions: Start in plank pose with your shoulders on top of your wrists and your heels on top of the balls of your feet
Without moving your hands or your feet, lift your hips up and back
Stay in downward facing dog pose for 1 to 3 minutes
yoga poses.form: Breathe deeply and smoothly and be aware of your body. Spread your fingers as you press down, and maintain your wrists and elbows straight. Open your shoulders and remove all tension from your neck. Straighten the knees, press your thighs back, lift the hips higher and push your heels down.
yoga poses.benefits: The downward facing dog is a great pose to relieve stress and calm the brain. This pose elongates the spine, stretches your arms, shoulders and legs, and eliminates stiffness and back pain. It also strengthens the upper body, boosts circulation, and invigorates the whole body.
yoga poses.routine: Start with plank, standing forward bend or cat cow pose and then progress to downward facing dog. Follow-up with standing forward bend or any other standing pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: Pregnancy, gastrointestinal problems, carpal tunnel syndrome, high blood pressure, and headache.
yoga poses.name: downward facing dog pose

instructions: Start in bound angle pose and then cross your right leg over the left, stacking one knee on top of the other
Bring your right arm up toward the ceiling, bend the elbow and rest your right palm on the upper back
Bring your left arm out to the side, palm facing back, and thumb down
Stay in cow face pose for 30 seconds and then repeat on the opposite side
yoga poses.form: Lengthen the spine, lift your right elbow toward the ceiling and lower the left elbow toward the floor. Breathe slowly, maintain your back straight, draw your hips toward the floor and keep your right forearm parallel to the spine.
yoga poses.benefits: The cow face pose opens the chest, hips, and shoulders, and stretches the ankles, thighs, and triceps. This pose also strengthens the spine, improves posture, and boosts your mood.
yoga poses.routine: Start with bound angle or reclining bound angle pose and then progress to cow face pose. Follow-up with half lord of the fishes, eagle pose or seated forward bend.
yoga poses.name: cow face pose

instructions: Stand up tall with your feet together, your spine long, and your arms by your sides
Rotate your arms so that the palms face away from the torso
Inhale and bring your arms up and overhead
Stay in Urdhva Hastasana for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: As you inhale, lift your arms, expand the chest, look up, and maintain your neck and head relaxed. Bring your palms together, lengthen the spine and stretch your shoulders and belly. Exhale as you release the stretch and bring your arms back down.
yoga poses.benefits: The upward salute pose stretches the front of your body and your shoulders, relaxes the mind, and improves digestion.
yoga poses.routine: Start with mountain pose and then progress to upward salute pose. Follow-up with standing forward bend.
yoga poses.name: urdhva hastasana

instructions: Start in low lunge pose with your right knee and the top of your right foot on the floor
Lift the right foot, reach your right hand back to grab the ankle, and walk your left foot a few inches to the front
Stay in low lunge quad stretch pose for 30 seconds and then switch leg positions
yoga poses.form: Keep the spine long, open the chest and face front. Engage your core for stability and walk your left foot to the front until you feel the stretch in your quads.
yoga poses.benefits: The low lunge quad stretch pose stretches the quads, groin, hip flexors, and glutes, and strengthens the knees. This pose also helps improve balance and concentration and alleviates lower back pain.
yoga poses.routine: Start in high lunge or low lunge pose and then progress to low lunge quad stretch pose. Follow-up with warrior I or warrior III poses.
yoga poses.name: low lunge quad stretch pose

instructions: Sit on the floor and cross your left leg over the right, stacking one knee on top of the other
Bend your elbows, raise and cross your forearms, so that the palms of your hands are facing each other
Stay in cow face pose with eagle arms for 30 seconds and then repeat with the arms and legs reversed
yoga poses.form: Lengthen the spine, open your back and rotate your shoulders inward. Keep your elbows down and maintain your forearms away from your face. Breathe slowly, face forward, and relax.
yoga poses.benefits: The cow face pose with eagle arms stretches the upper back and the shoulders, improves posture, and strengthens the spine. This pose also helps to open your hips and stretches the ankles and thighs.
related: easy pose with ear to shoulder stretch
yoga poses.routine: Start with reclining bound angle pose, cow face pose or bound angle pose and then progress to cow face pose with eagle arms. Follow-up with seated forward bend, half lord of the fishes or eagle pose.
yoga poses.name: cow face pose eagle arms

instructions: Start in mountain pose and, as you exhale, step your feet wide apart
Rotate your right foot out, to a 90-degree angle, and inhale as you raise your arms to the sides until they’re parallel with the floor
Exhale as you bring your right hand to the floor, lift your left leg up, reach the left arm toward the ceiling, and gaze at your left thumb
Hold the pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute and then repeat on the left side
yoga poses.form: Ground your right foot, keep the knee aligned with the toes and be careful not to lock the standing knee. Raise your left leg slightly above parallel to the floor, bring your right hand to the floor and reach the left arm toward the ceiling. Keep your left shoulder directly above the right, rotate your head to the left, and gaze at your left thumb.
yoga poses.benefits: The half moon pose strengthens the core, legs, and glutes, and stretches the chest, shoulders, spine, hamstrings, calves, and groins. This pose tones and stimulates the abdominal organs, improves coordination and balance and relieves tension.
yoga poses.routine: Start with extended triangle, standing forward bend or bound angle pose and then progress to half moon pose. Follow-up with revolved triangle pose or wide legged forward bend.
yoga poses.contraindications: Low blood pressure, neck or back injury, headaches, and insomnia.
yoga poses.name: half moon pose

instructions: Start in staff pose, with your hands on the floor and your fingers pointing forward
Bend your knees, place your feet on the floor and, as you exhale, lift your hips off the mat
Stay in upward plank pose for 30 seconds and then return to staff pose
yoga poses.form: Press your shoulders blades together, maintain your chest and hips up and straighten the legs. Keep your torso in line with your thighs and keep your arms perpendicular to the floor. Breathe deeply, drop your head slightly back, and feel the stretch in your shoulders and chest.
yoga poses.benefits: The upward plank pose stretches the chest and shoulders and boosts upper body strength. This yoga pose also helps to build core strength, improves balance, and stimulates the respiratory system.
yoga poses.routine: Start in bridge pose, bow pose or cow face pose and then progress to upward plank pose. Follow-up with seated forward bend or downward facing dog.
yoga poses.name: upward plank pose

instructions: Start in child’s pose, with your torso lying down and your arms stretched in front of you
Walk your knees out to the sides, as wide apart as it feels comfortable, and place your forearms on the mat
Flex your feet and rest the inside edges on the mat
Stay in frog pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Keep the focus on your breath, press your weight into your elbows, look down and push your hips slowly down and back. Feel the stretch in your hips and groin area, relax the neck, and maintain your knees, hips and ankle joints at 90-degree angles.
yoga poses.benefits: The frog pose opens the hip joints, reduces knee pain, strengthens the back, and improves posture. This pose also stimulates the digestive system, improves circulation, and reduces menstrual cramps.
yoga poses.routine: Start in child’s pose, bow pose or camel pose and then progress to frog pose. Follow-up with dolphin pose or lord of the dance pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: Knee, ankle, and lower back pain or injury.
yoga poses.name: frog pose

instructions: Sit on the floor with your feet together and your legs extended
Exhale as you bend at the hips and slowly lower your torso
Lengthen the spine, grab your feet and hold the pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Keep your spine long, lower and lengthen your torso until your belly and chest touch the thighs, and feel the stretch in the back of the legs. As you exhale, deepen the pose, stretch the arms, and try holding your feet.
yoga poses.benefits: The seated forward bend pose stretches the hamstrings, lengthens the spine, massages the abdominal organs, and calms the central nervous system. This pose also quiets the mind and reduces stress, anxiety, and fatigue.
yoga poses.routine: Start with child’s pose, or standing forward bend and then progress to seated forward bend pose. Follow-up with other seated twists or bends.
yoga poses.name: seated forward bend pose

instructions: Sit on the floor with both legs extended, the spine stacked vertically, and open the legs as wide as it feels comfortable
Bend your left knee and bring the sole of your left foot close to your right thigh
Raise your left arm, lean your torso to the right, grab your right foot with both hands, and gaze up
Stay in revolved head to knee pose for 30 seconds, then reverse leg positions and repeat
yoga poses.form: Exhale as you lean your torso to the right, lengthen the spine and keep your hips and thighs firmly grounded.
yoga poses.benefits: The revolved head to knee pose stretches the neck, shoulders, back, and hamstrings. This pose stimulates digestion and helps reduce bloating.
yoga poses.routine: Start with bound angle pose or head to knee forward bend and then progress to revolved head to knee pose. Follow-up with seated forward bend or wide angle seated forward bend pose.
yoga poses.name: revolved head to knee pose

instructions: Sit on the floor with your legs stretched out in front of you
Cross your legs, place each foot under the opposite knee and lengthen the spine
Stay in Sukhasana for as long as you like
yoga poses.form: The Sukhasana is a great pose for practicing mindful breathing. It is an extremely relaxing and comfortable pose that allows you to calm the brain and focus on your breath.
yoga poses.benefits: The easy pose relaxes and soothes the mind, reduces stress and anxiety levels, and promotes calm and serenity. This pose also improves spinal alignment, stretches the knees and ankles, and relieves hip tension.
yoga poses.routine: The Sukhasana is a preparatory pose that should be practiced at the beginning of your yoga sequence, to help you relax and focus on your breathing. Follow-up with standing forward bend, cat pose, child’s pose or any other pose you prefer.
yoga poses.name: sukhasana

instructions: Kneel on the floor, drop your chin toward the center of your collarbones, and then slowly bend forward
Place your head on the floor in front of your knees, grab the outside of your ankles and lift the glutes
Stay in rabbit pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Start with your knees hip-width apart and exhale as you slowly bend forward. Press your chin against the chest and raise your glutes as high as possible until your thighs are near vertical.
yoga poses.benefits: The rabbit pose stretches and lengthens the back, spine, arms, and shoulders. This is a relaxing pose that also stimulates your immune and endocrine systems.
yoga poses.routine: Start with cat pose, cow pose or bridge pose and then progress to rabbit pose. Follow-up with child’s pose or hero pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: Neck, spine, shoulder, or knee injury.
yoga poses.name: rabbit pose

instructions: Sit on the mat with your knees bent and lean your torso back
While keeping your knees bent, lift both feet until your legs are parallel to the floor and reach your arms toward the feet
Stay in half boat pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Keep your core engage and maintain your back flat at all times. Face front as you actively reach your arms toward the feet without arching the back. Breathe out as you release the pose.
yoga poses.benefits: The half boat pose strengthens your abs, back, and thighs, and improves your core balance and posture. This pose also helps to boost your focus and concentration, improves digestion, and tones your whole body.
yoga poses.routine: Start in bridge pose or downward facing dog and then progress to half boat pose. Follow-up with boat pose, bound angle pose or extended puppy pose.
yoga poses.name: half boat pose

instructions: Sit on the mat with your legs fully extended and lean your torso back
Raise both legs to a 45-degree angle and reach your arms to the front, keeping them parallel to the floor
Stay in boat pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Maintain your back flat, look ahead and actively reach your arms to the front. Keep your knees straight and breathe out as you release the pose.
yoga poses.benefits: The boat pose strengthens your abs, back and thighs, improves digestion and invigorates the whole body. This pose also helps to improve your balance and posture and boosts your focus and concentration.
yoga poses.routine: Start in standing forward bend or downward facing dog and then progress to boat pose. Follow-up with chair pose, bound angle pose or downward facing dog.
yoga poses.contraindications: Back or neck injury and low blood pressure.
yoga poses.name: boat pose

instructions: Stand up tall and bend forward by rotating your hip joints
Keep your knees straight and place your palms on the floor, or hold the back of your ankles
Stay in standing forward bend pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Exhale slowly as you bend from the hip joints, draw your belly slightly in and lengthen your torso. Press your heels into the floor, keep your knees straight and touch the back of your ankles or the floor with the palms of your hands. Try touching your knees with your head and hold. Breathe in as you release the stretch and then rotate the hip joints as you lift your torso back up
yoga poses.benefits: The standing forward bend or Uttanasana is a yoga pose that helps to improve circulation, increases the flexibility of the spine, and reduces accumulated stress and tension. This pose also helps to stretch the hamstrings, calves, and hips and strengthens the thighs and knees.
yoga poses.routine: Start with downward facing dog and follow-up with inversions, standing poses, or seated forward bends.
yoga poses.name: standing forward bend

instructions: Sit on the floor with both legs extended
Bend your left knee and place your left foot on top of your right thigh
Stay in lotus pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute, and then switch leg positions
yoga poses.form: Relax, breathe deeply, drop the shoulders back and open the chest. Lengthen the spine, gaze forward, and place your hands on the knees.
yoga poses.benefits: The lotus pose stretches the hips, knees, ankles, and thighs, and lengthens the spine. This pose also calms the brain and reduces stress and anxiety.
yoga poses.routine: Start with bound angle pose, hero pose or half lord of the fishes and then progress to lotus pose. Follow-up with downward facing dog or seated mountain pose.
yoga poses.name: lotus pose

instructions: Kneel on the floor, bring your feet together and open the knees
Place your hands on the floor between the knees, point your fingers back and extend your neck
Stay in lion pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Relax and inhale deeply as you press your hands against the floor. Lengthen the chest and neck, and roar like a lion as you exhale.
yoga poses.benefits: The lion pose stretches the chest and wrists and relieves tension in the neck and face. This is a soothing pose that helps reduce stress and anxiety.
yoga poses.routine: Start with hero pose, reclining bound angle or lotus pose and then progress to lion pose. Follow-up with downward facing dog or extended puppy pose.
yoga poses.name: lion pose

instructions: Start in mountain pose, transfer your weight to the left foot and bring your right knee up
Reach your right arm inside the thigh, cross it behind the ankle, and hold the outside of your right foot
Extend the leg forward and then slowly rotate it out to the side
Stay in extended hand to big toe pose for 30 seconds and then repeat on the opposite side
yoga poses.form: Breathe deeply and slowly and engage your core for better stability. Point your hip bones to the front and inhale as you extend your leg forward.
yoga poses.benefits: The extended hand to big toe pose strengthens the legs, thighs, knees, and ankles and improves balance. This yoga pose also stretches the back of the legs and boosts concentration and focus.
related: wide angle seated forward bend pose
yoga poses.routine: Start in mountain pose, standing forward bend or tree pose and then progress to extended hand to big toe pose. Follow-up with cobra pose or downward facing dog.
yoga poses.name: extended hand to big toe pose

instructions: Lie on your back with your arms by your sides and your legs extended
Bend your knees and lift your legs, buttocks, and back all at once
Bring your knees close to your forehead, and support your back with your hands
Slowly straighten your legs and spine, reach the toes to the floor, release the arms, squeeze the shoulder blades and interlace your fingers
Stay in plow pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Breathe deeply, support your weight on your shoulders and arms, and not on your neck and head. Keep your legs fully extended and maintain your torso perpendicular to the floor.
yoga poses.benefits: Plow pose stretches the shoulders and back, calms the brain, and helps release accumulated stress and tension. This pose also boosts circulation, strengthens the upper body, and stimulates the immune system.
yoga poses.routine: Start with shoulderstand pose or bridge pose and then progress to plow pose. Continue with downward facing dog or seated forward bend.
yoga poses.name: plow pose

instructions: Sit on the floor with your feet together and your legs extended
Place your hands on the floor and stack your spine vertically, or sit with your back against a wall
Stay in staff pose for 1 to 2 minutes
yoga poses.form: Open and lift your chest, face front, breathe deeply and rest your palms on the floor. Press the heels and thighs into the floor, drop your shoulders toward your back and lengthen the spine.
yoga poses.benefits: The staff pose lengthens and stretches the spine, improves posture, and strengthens the back muscles. This yoga pose also stretches the shoulders and chest and improves body alignment.
yoga poses.routine: Start in standing forward bend or downward facing dog and then progress to staff pose. Follow-up with upward plank pose or seated forward bend.
yoga poses.name: staff pose

instructions: Start in mountain pose, transfer your weight to the left leg, bend your right knee and bring your foot toward your right buttock
Reach back with your right hand, grasp your foot, and raise the left hand up toward the ceiling
Hold the pose for 20 to 30 seconds, return to mountain pose, and then repeat on the opposite side
yoga poses.form: Engage your core, open the chest, breathe deeply and shift your gaze upward. Lift your right foot up and back, and extend your right thigh parallel to the floor.
yoga poses.benefits: The lord of the dance pose is a backbend that opens up and stretches the chest, shoulders, quads, abs, and hip flexors. This pose strengthens the back, legs, and ankles, boosts concentration, and improves balance.
yoga poses.routine: Start with camel pose, bow pose or warrior I pose and then progress to lord of the dance pose. Continue with standing half forward bend or standing forward bend pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: Ankle, knee, hip, shoulder, neck, or back injury.
yoga poses.name: lord of the dance pose

instructions: Start in dolphin pose and position your hands close to a wall
Interlace your fingers, tuck your chin and place the crown of your head in front of the hands
Walk your feet in toward your elbows as much as you can, bend one knee at a time and bring it toward your chest
Find your balance and then straighten the legs up the wall
Stay in bound headstand pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute, return to dolphin pose and then rest into child’s pose
yoga poses.form: The bound headstand is an advanced pose that requires shoulder, core, and leg strength to be safely executed. Breathe deeply, maintain your body stable, keep the shoulders away from the ears and keep the weight out of your head and neck. Engage your core, arms, and legs and maintain your spine aligned.
yoga poses.benefits: The bound headstand is an inversion pose that invigorates the body, rejuvenates the cells, and strengthens the muscles. This yoga pose helps bring fresh nutrients and oxygen to the brain, face, scalp, hypothalamus and pituitary gland, and improves concentration and memory.
yoga poses.routine: Start in dolphin pose or crow pose and then progress to bound headstand pose. Follow-up with child’s pose or dolphin pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: High blood pressure, glaucoma, pregnancy, neck or shoulder injury.
yoga poses.name: bound headstand pose

instructions: Stand up straight, stretch your arms forward, open your back and cross your left arm on top of the right
Bend your elbows, raise and cross your forearms, so that the palms of your hands are facing each other
Bend your knees and put your weight on the left foot
Stay in eagle pose for 15 to 30 seconds and then repeat with the arms and legs reversed
yoga poses.form: Keep your elbows down, your forearms away from your face, and rotate your shoulders internally, opening up your back. Sit down low and feel the stretch in your hips.
yoga poses.benefits: The eagle pose helps to improve balance and increases your flexibility and strength. This pose helps to loosen the legs and hips and stretches the thighs, shoulders, and upper back.
yoga poses.routine: Start with downward facing dog, reclining bound angle, chair pose or tree pose and then progress to eagle pose. Follow-up with chair pose or tree pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: Shoulder, elbow, knee, or ankle injury.
yoga poses.name: eagle pose

instructions: Get down on your hands and knees
Sit on your heels, separate the knees, lay your torso down and stretch your arms in front of you
Rest your forehead on the mat and relax for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Keep your knees wide, your toes together, and extend your arms as far as you can. Rest your forehead on the mat, breathe slowly, and, as you exhale, try to deepen the stretch. Relax as you feel the stretch in your hips and lower back and release all tension.
yoga poses.benefits: The child’s pose is a great stretch for the lower back, glutes, hips, thighs, knees, and ankles. This is a very soothing and calming pose that you can use every time you feel stressed or overwhelmed. This pose also relaxes the spine, shoulders, and neck, and massages your internal organs.
yoga poses.routine: Balasana is a resting pose that can precede or follow any other yoga pose.
yoga poses.name: childs pose

instructions: Start in garland pose, place your hands flat on the floor, and spread your fingers wide
Bend your elbows, shift your weight forward and position your knees onto your triceps
Lift your feet off the floor and straighten your arms as much as possible
Stay in crow pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Gaze forward, engage your core, keep your hips up and maintain your neck neutral. Breathe out as lift your feet off the floor and tuck your heels as close to your buttocks as possible.
yoga poses.benefits: The crow pose strengthens the arms, shoulders, and core and stretches the upper back. This yoga pose also opens the groins, improves balance, and boosts upper body strength.
yoga poses.routine: Start in garland pose, bound angle or child’s pose and then progress to crow pose. Follow-up with plank or low plank pose.
yoga poses.name: crow pose

instructions: Start in one legged downward dog pose, with your hands and left foot pressed firmly against the mat and your right leg extended up and back
Shift your shoulders over the wrists and bring your right knee toward the nose
Return to one legged downward dog pose and repeat with the opposite leg
yoga poses.form: Place your hands and feet on the mat and lift your hips up and back. Inhale as you reach your right leg to the back and then exhale as you move your shoulders over the wrists and bring your right knee toward the nose. Maintain your left leg and your arms straight and breathe in as you push your shoulders back to return to one legged downward dog pose. Breathe out as you place your right foot on the floor and return to downward dog pose.
yoga poses.benefits: The dog split knee to nose flow improves core balance, strength and definition, revs up the metabolism, and boosts your endurance and stamina. This core flow also strengthens your upper and lower body, improves circulation, and helps with weight loss.
yoga poses.routine: Start in downward dog pose, move into one legged downward dog pose and then go into knee to nose dog pose. Follow-up with one legged downward dog pose and then return to downward dog pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: Pregnancy, gastrointestinal problems, carpal tunnel syndrome, high blood pressure, and headache.
yoga poses.name: knee to nose dog pose

instructions: Lie down on your back and pull both knees up to your chest
Slowly pull the knees toward the shoulders until you feel the stretch in your lower back
Stay in knees to chest pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Lift both legs, clasp your hands around the knees, and, as you exhale, tighten the grip. As you inhale, loosen the grip and relax. Breathe smoothly, keep your back flat on the mat and lengthen the spine.
yoga poses.benefits: The knees to chest pose stretches and eases tension in the lower back and massages the abdominal organs. This pose reduces bloating, improves circulation, and rebalances your energy.
related: half lord of the fishes pose
yoga poses.routine: Start with bridge pose or supine spinal twist and then progress to knees to chest pose. Follow-up with wind release pose or standing forward bend pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: Neck, back, or hip injury and hernia.
yoga poses.name: knees to chest pose

instructions: Start in mountain pose and, as you exhale, step your feet wide apart and lift your arms up to shoulder height
Rotate your feet out to the sides, bend your elbows and turn the palms facing each other
Exhale as you bend the knees and squat down
Stay in goddess pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Plant your feet firmly on the ground and keep your knees in line with your toes. Lengthen the spine, open the chest, look straight ahead and draw your shoulders down and back. Press the hips forward, keep your arms engaged and press the knees back.
yoga poses.benefits: The goddess pose strengthens the thighs, glutes, core, and shoulders, boosts circulation, and opens the hips, groins, and chest.
yoga poses.routine: Start with mountain pose or upward salute pose and then progress to goddess pose. Follow-up with wide legged forward bend or standing forward bend.
yoga poses.name: goddess pose

instructions: Lie on your belly with your legs together, arms extended back, and your chin on the floor
Inhale and lift the chest, head, arms, and legs off the floor
Stay in locust pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Maintain your neck in line with the spine and keep the back muscles, glutes and thighs engaged. Gaze forward, lift your chest, and drop your shoulders down and back. Stretch your arms back, and actively lengthen the legs.
yoga poses.benefits: The locust pose opens and stretches the chest, shoulders, abs, and quads, and strengthens the back, core, glutes, arms, and legs. This pose also stimulates the abdominal organs and improves balance and posture.
yoga poses.routine: Start with cobra, upward facing dog or warrior I pose and then progress to locust pose. Follow-up with bridge pose or shoulderstand pose.
yoga poses.name: locust pose

instructions: Start in mountain pose, step to the side with your left foot and rotate it out, to a 90-degree angle
Bend your left knee, keeping it in line with the ankle
Rotate your head to the left, bring the arms up to shoulder height, and keep them parallel to the floor, with the palms facing down
Hold the pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute, reverse the feet and repeat
yoga poses.form: Firm your thighs, keep the heels aligned, and bend your left knee until your thigh is as close to parallel to the floor as possible. Raise your arms, reach them out to the sides and widen the shoulder blades. Maintain your torso straight and long, with the shoulders over your pelvis and the tailbone pressed toward the pubis, and look out and over your left fingers.
yoga poses.benefits: The Virabhadrasana II stretches the shoulders, chest, and groins, and strengthens the legs and ankles. This pose stimulates the abdominal organs and improves your balance and endurance.
yoga poses.routine: Start in mountain pose or downward facing dog and then progress to warrior II pose. Follow-up with warrior I pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: Knee, hip or neck injury, and high blood pressure.
yoga poses.name: warrior ii pose

instructions: Kneel on the floor with your legs hip-width apart
Tighten your core, lift your rib cage, lean back and reach your hands toward the heels
Drop your head gently back and gaze at the tip of your nose
Stay in camel pose for 20 to 30 seconds
yoga poses.form: Keep your head, neck, and glutes relaxed, rotate your hips inward and elongate the spine. Maintain your thighs perpendicular to the floor, lift your heart, lean back and reach your hands toward the heels. Breathe slowly and keep the lower spine as long as possible.
yoga poses.benefits: The camel pose opens the chest, strengthens the back, and stretches the entire front of the body. This pose massages the abdominal organs, improves breathing, and reduces stress and tension.
related: half lord of the fishes pose
yoga poses.routine: Start with cobra pose or bow pose and then progress to camel pose. Follow-up with shoulderstand pose or bridge pose.
yoga poses.name: camel pose

instructions: to 20 seconds
yoga poses.form: Draw your shoulder blades together, feel the stretch in your abs, chest, and front of your thighs and breathe deeply. Press your feet and hands into the floor, keep your head and neck neutral, and gaze back.
yoga poses.benefits: The wheel pose stretches the front of the body and strengthens the arms, legs, abs, and glutes. This pose stimulates the thyroid and pituitary glands, boosts the metabolism, and increases your energy levels.
yoga poses.routine: Start in cobra pose, bridge pose or upward facing dog and then progress to wheel pose. Follow-up with half lord of the fishes or knees to chest pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: High or low blood pressure and back or shoulder injury.
yoga poses.name: wheel pose

instructions: Start in standing forward bend and, as you inhale, step your right leg straight back
Lift your torso and sweep your arms out to the sides and overhead
Stay in crescent lunge pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
Exhale, place your hands on the floor, step your left leg back, beside the right, and walk your hands back to standing forward bend
Repeat with the opposite leg
yoga poses.form: Straighten your right leg, relax the hips and keep the front knee directly over the ankle. Lift your chest, elongate the spine and neck, look up, and keep your arms perpendicular to the floor.
yoga poses.benefits: The crescent lunge pose stretches the groin area, opens the hips, strengthens the legs and arms, and lengthens the spine. This pose also helps improve your balance and coordination and build mental focus.
yoga poses.routine: Start with low lunge pose or standing forward bend pose and then progress to crescent lunge pose. Follow-up with warrior I or warrior III poses.
yoga poses.contraindications: Neck, knee, hip, or back injury.
yoga poses.name: crescent lunge pose

instructions: Start in plank pose with your hands under the elbows and the elbows under the shoulders
As you exhale, roll forward on your toes and bend your elbows until your arms form a 90-degree angle
Stay in Chaturanga Dandasana for 15 to 30 seconds
yoga poses.form: Keep your core engaged, your abs pulled in, and maintain your elbows close to your torso. Pull your shoulders away from your ears, look forward, and maintain your torso and legs in line and parallel to the floor. If you don’t have enough core strength, or if you feel tired, keep your core engaged, lower your knees to the floor and work on maintaining proper alignment.
yoga poses.benefits: The low plank is a great yoga pose to tone your abs, trim the waist and strengthen your arms, shoulders, and wrists.
yoga poses.routine: Start with Adho Mukha Svanasana or plank pose and then progress to Chaturanga Dandasana. Follow-up with upward facing dog or downward facing dog pose.
yoga poses.name: chaturanga dandasana

instructions: Start in side plank pose, with your left foot and leg on top of the right
Lift your left leg up and grab your big toe with your left hand
Stay in extended side plank for 30 seconds, return to side plank pose and then repeat on the opposite side
yoga poses.form: Maintain the hips high, plant your right hand and foot firmly on the floor and roll your right shoulder back. Gaze at your left foot and keep both legs straight.
yoga poses.benefits: The full side plank pose strengthens the wrists, arms, shoulders, core, and legs and stretches the hips and hamstrings. This yoga pose also helps to improve balance and stability, relieves tension, and prevents lower back pain.
yoga poses.routine: Start in side plank pose and then progress to full side plank pose. Follow-up with plank pose or downward facing dog.
yoga poses.contraindications: Wrist, elbow, neck, shoulder, or back injury.
yoga poses.name: full side plank pose

instructions: Start in standing forward bend, with your feet a little wider than hip-width apart and your knees slightly bent
Position your shoulders behind the calf muscles, bring your feet closer together and hug your thighs in
Place your palms on the floor behind your feet, lower your hips and lift the feet off the floor
Stay in firefly pose for 15 seconds or for as long as it feels comfortable
yoga poses.form: Squeeze the thighs toward the midline of the body, lift your chest, and gaze forward. Breathe slowly, press your hands down into the floor, firm your forearms, drop your hips toward the wrists and straighten the legs.
yoga poses.benefits: The firefly pose strengthens the core, shoulders, and arms and improves balance and equilibrium. This yoga pose helps to open the groin area, stretches the upper back, and builds upper body strength.
yoga poses.routine: Start in standing forward bend, crow pose or garland pose and then progress to firefly pose. Follow-up with standing forward bend or downward facing dog.
yoga poses.contraindications: Wrist, elbow, shoulder, or back injury.
yoga poses.name: firefly pose

instructions: Lie on your back with your sitting bones as close to the wall as comfortable
Extend your legs up the wall, so that the back of your legs is resting fully against it
Stay in this pose for 5 to 15 minutes
yoga poses.form: Fully release and relax your body and focus on deep breathing. Clear your mind, let go and surrender to a peaceful and meditative state.
yoga poses.benefits: The legs up the wall is an inversion pose that can help reverse the effects of gravity on the whole system. This pose helps to remove fluids and toxins from the body, regulates blood pressure, and improves digestion. The Viparita Karani is a deeply relaxing pose that, when combined with mindful breathing, activates the parasympathetic nervous system. This will help decrease stress and anxiety levels, and your body will start to heal and repair.
yoga poses.routine: Start with standing forward bend, reclining bound angle or bridge pose. Go into legs up the wall pose and then follow-up with Savasana.
yoga poses.name: viparita karani

instructions: Start in mountain pose and, as you exhale, step your feet wide apart
Bend forward by rotating your hip joints, place your palms on the floor, bend your elbows and lower your head and torso
Stay in wide legged forward bend pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Plant your feet firmly on the ground and exhale as you lean the torso forward. Lengthen the spine, draw your shoulders away from the ears and keep your arms parallel to each other.
yoga poses.benefits: The wide legged forward bend pose strengthens and stretches the legs and spine. This pose also tones and stimulates the abdominal organs, reduces back pain, and relieves stress and tension.
yoga poses.routine: Start with downward facing dog, reclining bound angle or standing forward bend pose and then progress to wide legged forward bend pose. Follow-up with bound angle pose or seated forward bend.
yoga poses.name: wide legged forward bend pose

instructions: Lie on your back, bend your knees, rotate your hips to the left, extend your left leg, and cross your right knee over to the left side
Extend your right arm out to the side and rest your left hand on your right knee
Turn your head to the right and hold the pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
Exhale as you release the pose, and repeat on the opposite side
yoga poses.form: Lift your hips slightly off the floor as you rotate them to the left, and draw your right knee toward the chest. Extend your left leg, cross your right knee over to the left, and stack your right hip on top of the left hip. Extend your right arm, keeping it in line with your shoulder, rotate your head to the right, and gaze at your fingertips. Rest your left hand on your right knee, relax, and focus on your breathing.
yoga poses.benefits: The supine spinal twist pose massages the abdominal organs, calms the mind, and relaxes the body. This pose also relieves lower back pain, opens the shoulders, and elongates the spine.
yoga poses.routine: Start with bridge pose, or wind release pose and then progress to supine spinal twist pose. Follow-up with reclining bound angle pose or savasana.
yoga poses.name: supine spinal twist pose

instructions: Kneel on the floor with your knees together and your feet hip-width apart
Sit back between your feet, place your hands on your thighs, and gaze forward
Stay in hero pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute, or for as long as it feels comfortable
yoga poses.form: Breathe deeply, relax, drop the shoulders down and back and lengthen the spine. Lift your chest, widen the collarbones and relax the face.
yoga poses.benefits: The hero pose stretches the quads, knees, and ankles, lengthens the spine, and calms the brain.
yoga poses.routine: Start with child’s pose, extended puppy or bound angle pose and then progress to hero pose. Follow-up with lotus pose or camel pose.
yoga poses.name: hero pose

instructions: Lie on your back, exhale and bend your knees into the belly
Inhale and hold the outside edge of your feet
Open your knees and bring them up toward your armpits
Hold the pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Turn the soles of your feet to face the ceiling and stack your ankles over the knees, keeping your shins perpendicular to the floor. Roll your tailbone toward the floor and, as you hold the pose for a few breaths, try getting in touch with your inner child.
yoga poses.benefits: The happy baby pose lengthens the spine, releases tension in the lower back, opens the hips and the inner thighs, and stretches the hamstrings. This pose also helps to relieve stress and fatigue and calms the brain.
yoga poses.routine: Start with child’s pose and then progress to happy baby pose. Follow-up with downward facing dog or any seated pose.
yoga poses.name: happy baby pose

instructions: Start in easy pose with your back straight and arms relaxed
Place your right hand on the left knee and twist your torso to the left
Hold the pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute, switch sides, and repeat
yoga poses.form: Keep your shoulders and neck relaxed, soften the belly and lift the sternum to lengthen the torso. Take deep breaths, draw your tailbone toward the floor and keep the lower back long.
yoga poses.benefits: The seated spinal twist stretches the spine, shoulders, and hips, and strengthens the lower back. This pose massages the abdominal organs and relieves neck and lower back tension.
yoga poses.routine: Start in easy pose and then progress to seated spinal twist pose. Follow-up with seated side bend or seated mountain pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: Hip, back, neck, or shoulder injury.
yoga poses.name: parivrtta sukhasana

instructions: Start in sphinx pose, bend your knees and grab the ankles
As you inhale, lift your hips and chest off the floor
As you exhale, lift your gaze and kick your feet up
Stay in bow pose for 20 to 30 seconds
yoga poses.form: Bring your heels close to your buttocks, lift the hips, open your chest, and gaze forward. Keep your glutes and back muscles soft, and press your shoulder blades together.
yoga poses.benefits: The bow pose is a backbend that opens up the chest, shoulders, and hips. This pose strengthens the upper back, massages the internal organs, and relieves stress and tension.
related: half lord of the fishes pose
yoga poses.routine: Start in sphinx pose or cobra pose and then progress to bow pose. Follow-up with bridge pose, camel pose or upward facing dog pose.
yoga poses.name: bow pose

instructions: Start in mountain pose and, as you inhale, bring your arms up, with the palms facing each other
As you exhale, bend your knees and sit back
Stay in chair pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Open your chest, elongate the spine, push your pelvis down and relax. Keep your thighs and torso at a 90-degree angle, and maintain your lower back long.
yoga poses.benefits: The chair pose stretches the shoulders and chest, and strengthens the ankles, thighs, calves, and lower back. This pose also stimulates the heart and abdominal organs, balances the body, and improves your focus and determination.
yoga poses.routine: Start with mountain pose, or downward facing dog and then progress to chair pose. Follow-up with standing forward bend or mountain pose.
yoga poses.name: chair pose

instructions: Lie on your back and bend both knees
Cross your left leg over the right, clasp both hands around the back of your right leg’s thigh and bring the right knee toward the chest
Stay in eye of the needle pose for 30 seconds, then reverse leg positions and repeat
yoga poses.form: Keep your back flat on the mat and, as you exhale, draw your knee in toward your chest. Stretch only as far as it feels comfortable and breathe deeply and slowly.
yoga poses.benefits: The eye of the needle pose stretches the glutes, hips, and lower back. This yoga pose increases blood flow and circulation to the legs and hips, relieves cramps, and reduces anxiety.
yoga poses.routine: Start with knees to chest pose or happy baby pose and then progress to eye of the needle pose. Follow-up with supine spinal twist or wind release pose.
yoga poses.name: eye of the needle pose

instructions: Start in plank pose, bring your feet together, and roll onto your left side, placing the outside edge of your left foot on the mat
Stack your right foot and leg on top of the left, reach your right arm toward the ceiling and gaze at your right thumb
Stay in side plank pose for 15 to 30 seconds and then switch sides
yoga poses.form: Open the chest, stack your hips and keep your body in a straight line. Breathe slowly, strengthen the thighs, and press through the heels toward the floor.
yoga poses.benefits: The side plank pose strengthens the core, arms, and legs, and improves your balance and posture.
yoga poses.routine: Start with downward facing dog, half moon pose or plank pose and then progress to side plank pose. Follow-up with tree pose or warrior II pose.
yoga poses.name: side plank pose

instructions: Lie on your stomach with your forehead on the floor, palms beside your waist, and your legs stretched back
Inhale, straighten your arms, lift your torso up, press the top of your feet into the floor and lift your thighs
Stay in Urdhva Mukha Svanasana for 15 to 30 seconds
yoga poses.form: Straighten your arms and keep them perpendicular to the floor, open your chest and draw the shoulder blades onto your back. Face front, bring your tailbone toward your pubic bone, and draw the navel in and up.
yoga poses.benefits: The upward facing dog pose opens the heart, chest, and lungs, improves posture, and stretches the front of your body and your upper back. It also strengthens the arms, shoulders and spine, and stimulates the abdominal organs.
yoga poses.routine: Start with bridge pose or cobra pose and follow-up with downward facing dog or backbends.
yoga poses.name: upward facing dog pose

instructions: Start in downward dog pose and step your left foot forward between your hands and slightly to the left
Lower your hips, walk your hands forward and come down onto your forearms
Stay in lizard pose for 30 seconds and then repeat with the opposite leg
yoga poses.form: Keep the focus on your breathing, look straight ahead, lengthen the spine and draw your shoulder blades together. Feel the stretch in the hips and groin area, go slowly and be careful not to push your body beyond its limits.
yoga poses.benefits: The lizard pose stretches the groin area, opens the hips, hamstrings and hip flexors, strengthens the legs, and prepares the body for deeper hip openers. This pose also helps to revitalize the body, boosts the metabolism, and relieves stress and anxiety.
related: wide legged forward bend twist pose
head to knee forward bend pose
yoga poses.routine: Start with downward dog or warrior II pose and then progress to lizard pose. Follow-up with pigeon pose or chair pose.
yoga poses.name: lizard pose

instructions: Stand up tall with your feet together, your spine long, and your body soft
Bring your palms together in front of the heart
Stay in Tadasana for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Distribute your weight equally between both feet, breathe easily, close your eyes and feel the energy flowing through your body.
yoga poses.benefits: The mountain pose or Tadasana helps to improve posture, strengthens the legs, thighs, knees, and ankles, and firms the abdomen and buttocks.
yoga poses.routine: Tadasana is usually the starting position for all the standing poses and it’s also a great resting pose, perfect to center and focus on your breathing.
yoga poses.contraindications: Headaches, low blood pressure, or dizziness.
yoga poses.name: tadasana

instructions: Start in mountain pose and, as you exhale, bend your knees and sit back
Twist your torso to the right, place your left elbow on your right knee, and turn your gaze toward the ceiling
Stay in revolved chair pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute and then repeat on the opposite side
yoga poses.form: Stabilize your pelvis down and back, and don’t let one knee slide in front of the other. Press your hands together, draw your shoulder blades down and back, and gaze up.
yoga poses.benefits: The revolved chair pose stretches and opens the chest, shoulders, and upper back, and strengthens the glutes, thighs, ankles, calves, and lower back. This pose stimulates the heart and abdominal organs, increases balance and focus and improves joint range of motion.
yoga poses.routine: Start with mountain pose or chair pose and then progress to revolved chair pose. Continue with standing forward bend or mountain pose.
yoga poses.name: revolved chair pose

instructions: Start in mountain pose, bend at the hips and place both hands on the floor
Shift your weight onto the left foot and slowly straighten your right leg up and back
Grab the back of your left leg with your left hand and lay your torso on the left thigh
Stay in standing split pose for 30 seconds, return to standing forward bend, reverse leg positions and repeat
yoga poses.form: Exhale as you bend at the hips and extend your raised leg up and back. Keep the knee and hip of the standing leg facing front and deepen the stretch as you exhale.
yoga poses.benefits: The standing split pose stretches the back of the legs, strengthens the thighs, and increases the flexibility of the spine. This is a very soothing pose that helps to calm the brain and relieves accumulated stress and tension.
related: cow face pose with eagle arms
yoga poses.routine: Start with standing forward bend, wide legged forward bend or head to knee forward bend and then progress to standing split pose. Follow-up with upward dog pose or cobra pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: Ankle, knee, hip, or back injury.
yoga poses.name: standing split pose

instructions: Sit on the floor with your legs extended, feet together and your spine stacked vertically
Bring your right foot out to the right, work your right arm under your right knee and place your right hand on the floor with the fingers pointing forward
Position your left hand on the outside of your left hip and on an equal plane with your right hand
Lift your right leg, rest the back of the knee on your right triceps and then press your hands into the floor to lift your left leg and hips off the ground
Stay in elephant pose for 30 seconds, then reverse leg positions and repeat on the opposite side
yoga poses.form: Keep your focus on your breathing, maintain both feet pointed, and gaze forward. Exhale as you exit the pose and sit back on the floor.
yoga poses.benefits: The elephant pose helps to stabilize your pelvic area, opens the hips, and improves your focus and concentration. This pose also boosts upper body and arm strength and improves your balance and coordination.
yoga poses.routine: Start with easy pose or staff pose and then progress to elephant pose. Follow-up with pigeon pose, head to knee forward bend, or corpse pose.
yoga poses.name: elephant pose

instructions: Start in downward facing dog and, as you exhale, step your right foot forward between your hands
Lower your left knee to the floor and place the top of the left foot on the floor
Inhale, lift your torso up and sweep your arms out to the sides and overhead
Stay in low lunge pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
Exhale, place your hands on the floor, lift your left knee up, step back, and return to downward facing dog pose
Repeat with the opposite leg
yoga poses.form: Slide the leg that’s on the floor back until you feel a comfortable stretch in your front thigh and groin. Lift your chest, elongate your spine and neck, look up and keep your arms perpendicular to the floor.
yoga poses.benefits: The low lunge pose stretches the hamstrings, quads, groin and glutes, and strengthens the knees. This pose also helps to improve balance and concentration and builds mental focus.
yoga poses.routine: Start with downward facing dog and then progress to Anjaneyasana. Follow-up with warrior I or warrior III poses.
yoga poses.contraindications: Neck, knee, hip, or back injury.
yoga poses.name: anjaneyasana

instructions: Start on all fours with your shoulders over your wrists and your hips over your knees
Walk your hands forward, pull your hips back toward the heels and lengthen the spine
Rest your forehead on the mat and relax for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Exhale as you lengthen the spine, don’t let your elbows touch the mat and press your hands down. Relax your neck and feel the stretch in your shoulders and spine.
yoga poses.benefits: The extended puppy is a very soothing and relaxing pose that helps to calm the mind and relieves stress and tension. This pose also stretches and improves the flexibility of the spine, hips, shoulders and upper back.
yoga poses.routine: Start in downward facing dog, cat or cow pose and then progress to extended puppy pose. Follow-up with child’s pose or downward facing dog.
yoga poses.name: extended puppy pose

instructions: Start in mountain pose, take a step back with your right leg, align the heels and rotate the right foot slightly out
Bend from the hips, lay your torso on your left thigh and place your hands or fingertips on the floor
Stay in intense side stretch pose for 30 seconds and then switch leg positions
yoga poses.form: Keep your hips squared and facing the front edge of your mat and maintain both legs straight and strong. Exhale as you bend from the hips, lengthen the spine and press the soles of the feet on the floor.
yoga poses.benefits: The intense side stretch pose stretches and lengthens the back of the legs and spine, and stimulates digestion. This is a soothing pose that also improves your strength, stability, and flexibility.
yoga poses.routine: Start with extended triangle pose, standing forward bend or tree pose and then progress to intense side stretch pose. Follow-up with warrior I pose or wide legged forward bend.
yoga poses.name: intense side stretch pose

instructions: Sit on the floor, bend your legs and pull your knees toward your body
Let your thighs fall open, press the soles of your feet together and carefully pull your heels toward your pelvis
Exhale and lie down with your arms alongside your body and your palms facing up
Stay in reclining bound angle pose for 1 to 5 minutes
yoga poses.form: Take deep and conscious breaths and feel the air going through your body. Imagine that your groins are settling deep into your pelvis and dropping toward the floor and let your knees stay soft and relaxed.
yoga poses.benefits: The reclining bound angle pose stretches the groins, inner thighs, and hips, and helps relieve the symptoms of stress, anxiety, and depression. It also stimulates the abdominal and reproductive organs, improves digestion and increases blood circulation.
yoga poses.routine: Start with bound angle pose and then lower your back torso to reclining bound angle pose. Follow-up with standing poses, seated twists, or forward bends.
yoga poses.contraindications: Knee or groin injury and lower back pain.
yoga poses.name: reclining bound angle pose

instructions: Lie on your belly with your legs extended back and your forearms flat on the floor
Inhale, press your forearms down, and lift your head and chest off the floor
Hold the pose for a few breaths and then exhale as you slowly lower the chest and head back to the floor
yoga poses.form: Keep your neck in line with your spine, maintain your elbows close to your torso and under your shoulders, and keep your forearms on the floor and parallel to each other. Open the chest, drop the shoulders down and back, firm the glutes, lengthen your tailbone toward the heels, and press the pubic bone down into the floor.
yoga poses.benefits: The sphinx pose aligns the spine, opens the chest, stretches the shoulders, and strengthens the core and glutes. This pose also stimulates the abdominal organs and relieves stress and tension.
yoga poses.routine: Start with plank pose and then progress to sphinx pose. Follow-up with cobra pose or bridge pose.
yoga poses.name: sphinx pose

instructions: Sit down on the mat, bend your knees, press the soles of your feet together, and drop your knees out to the sides
Lengthen your torso, grasp your big toes and stay in bound angle pose for 1 minute to 2 minutes
yoga poses.form: Bring your heels close to your pelvis, press the hips down, lengthen your spine, drop the shoulders down and back and open your chest.
yoga poses.benefits: The bound angle pose opens and stretches the inner thighs, groins, hips, and chest, and lengthens the spine. This pose also stimulates the abdominal organs and the respiratory system and improves circulation.
related: half lord of the fishes pose
yoga poses.routine: Start in tree pose or easy pose and then progress to bound angle pose. Follow-up with seated forward bend, seated spinal twist or reclining bound angle.
yoga poses.name: bound angle pose

instructions: Kneel on the floor and extend your right leg out to the side
Lean your torso to the right and place your right hand on the shin
Extend your left arm over the top of your head, pointing your fingers in the same direction as the right toes, and gaze up toward the ceiling
Stay in gate pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute and then repeat on the opposite side
yoga poses.form: Keep the bent knee directly below the hip and press the opposite foot on the floor. Maintain your back flat and actively reach your left arm to the side. Breathe in as you release the pose, bring both arms up, and then switch sides.
yoga poses.benefits: The gate pose strengthens and stretches the oblique muscles, inner thighs, hamstrings, and the spine. This pose also helps to improve your flexibility and stimulates the thoracic and abdominal muscles and organs.
yoga poses.routine: Start in wide legged forward bend, wide angle seated bend or bound angle pose and then advance to gate pose. Follow-up with extended side angle pose or extended triangle pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: Knee, hip, back, or neck injury.
yoga poses.name: gate pose

instructions: Start in easy pose and place your left hand on the floor with your elbow slightly bent
Reach your right arm up and overhead and lean to the left side
Hold the pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute, switch sides, and repeat
yoga poses.form: Breathe slowly and deeply, keep the hips grounded and, as you lean your torso to the left, pull your rib cage to the right.
yoga poses.benefits: The seated side bend is a soothing yoga pose that stretches the neck, shoulders, back, and obliques. This pose helps to relax the mind and relieves stress and anxiety.
yoga poses.routine: Start in Sukhasana and then progress to seated side bend. Follow-up with seated spinal twist or seated mountain pose.
yoga poses.name: parsva sukhasana

instructions: Lie on your back with your feet together and arms by your sides
Inhale as you lift one leg and bend the knee
Exhale as you pull the knee toward your chest and press your thigh into your belly
Hold the pose for 30 seconds, exhale as you release, and repeat with the opposite leg
yoga poses.form: Lift one or both legs, clasp your hands around the knees and, as you exhale, tighten the grip, lift your head and chest off the floor, and try touching your knees with your chin. As you inhale, loosen the grip and relax.
yoga poses.benefits: The wind release pose massages the abdominal organs, reduces bloating, eases tension in the lower back and improves circulation. This pose also tones and strengthens your legs, arms, back, and abs.
yoga poses.routine: Start with child’s pose and then progress to Pawanmuktasana. Follow-up with seated poses, happy baby pose, or standing forward bend pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: High blood pressure, neck or back injury, and heart condition.
yoga poses.name: pawanmuktasana

instructions: Start on your hands and knees with your knees under the hips and your hands under the shoulders
Exhale and round your spine toward the ceiling
Inhale as you come back to a neutral position and repeat 10 to 20 times
yoga poses.form: As you round your back, exhale and maintain your hands and knees in the same position. Release your head toward the floor and feel the stretch in your spine and neck.
yoga poses.benefits: The cat pose stretches the neck and spine, helps to relieve stress and tension, and massages the abdominal organs.
yoga poses.routine: Start with child’s pose and then move to cat pose. As you inhale go into cow pose, to reinvigorate the spine and stimulate the abdominal organs.
yoga poses.name: cat pose

instructions: Get down on your hands and knees, with your knees under the hips and your hands under the shoulders
Press your palms and forearms into the floor, place the soles of your feet on the floor and as you straighten the knees, lift your hips up and back
Stay in dolphin pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute
yoga poses.form: Exhale as you straighten the knees, press your thighs back, lift the hips and push your heels down. Press the forearms into the floor, draw your shoulder blades together and be careful not to round your back.
yoga poses.benefits: The dolphin pose opens the chest, stretches the back of the legs and shoulders, and strengthens the arms and legs. This pose helps to elongate the spine, relieves stress, and calms the brain.
yoga poses.routine: Start with plank pose, standing forward bend or cat-cow pose and then progress to dolphin pose. Continue with downward facing dog or child’s pose.
yoga poses.name: dolphin pose

instructions: Start on your hands and knees with your hands directly under the shoulders and your knees under the hips
Inhale as you lift your head, chest, and hips, and curve your belly down toward the floor
Exhale as you come back to a neutral position and repeat 10 to 20 times
yoga poses.form: As you curve your belly, inhale and maintain your hands and knees static. Coordinate the movement with your breath and don’t let your mind wander. Always come back to your breath to keep body and mind connected.
yoga poses.benefits: The cow pose helps to relieve back and neck tension, stretches the chest and neck, and warms up the spine. This pose also stimulates and massages the abdominal organs.
yoga poses.routine: Start with legs up the wall and then move to cow pose. Pair the cow pose with cat pose, as you exhale, to allow the energy to flow.
yoga poses.name: cow pose

instructions: Start in standing forward bend and, as you inhale, step your left leg straight back
Lay your torso on your right thigh and hold for 30 seconds to 1 minute
Exhale, step your right leg back, beside the left, and walk your hands back to standing forward bend
Repeat with the opposite leg
yoga poses.form: Look forward, sink your right thigh toward the floor, straighten your left leg and push your left thigh up. Relax the hips, keep the front knee directly over the ankle, and face front with the chin parallel to the floor.
yoga poses.benefits: The high lunge pose stretches the groin area, opens the hips, strengthens the legs and arms, and lengthens the spine.
yoga poses.routine: Start with standing forward bend and then progress to high lunge pose. Follow-up with plank or downward facing dog pose.
yoga poses.contraindications: Neck, legs, hip, or back injury.
yoga poses.name: high lunge pose

instructions: Start in warrior I pose, rotate your torso to the left, and exhale as you place your right hand on the outside of your left foot
Extend your left arm over the top of your head, pointing your fingertips in the same direction as the front toes, and gaze up toward the ceiling
Hold the pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute and then repeat on the opposite side
yoga poses.form: Keep your left shin perpendicular to the floor and keep your left shoulder directly over the right. Lengthen the spine and maintain your back heel, spine, and head in one straight line.
yoga poses.benefits: The revolved side angle pose strengthens the legs and stretches the chest, shoulders, spine, and groins. This pose also stimulates the abdominal organs, improves circulation and balance, and increases stamina.
yoga poses.routine: Start with revolved triangle pose or bound angle pose and then progress to revolved side angle pose. Follow-up with eagle pose, half lord of the fishes or seated spinal twist.
yoga poses.contraindications: Neck, legs, hips, or back injury.
yoga poses.name: revolved side angle pose

instructions: Sit on the floor with your legs crossed and lengthen the spine
Interlace your hands behind your back and bring them toward your right hip
As you exhale gently drop your right ear toward your right shoulder
Stay in easy pose with ear to shoulder stretch for 30 seconds, switch sides, and repeat
